Info.Description: This module can be used for characterizing liver lesion for MRI

ChoiceDataElement.Label: What is the pretreatment size category?
Untreated observation without pathologic proof in patient at high-risk for HCC
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Observation: generically applies to any apparent abnormality detected at imaging. As a generic term, it is preferred over lesion or nodule, since some observations (e.g. perfusion alterations, artifacts) may represent pseudolesions rather than true lesions or nodules
ChoiceDataElement.VoiceCommand: Untreated observation without pathologic proof in patient at high-risk for HCC

Choice.Label: Cannot be categorized due to image degradation or omission
Choice.Hint: due to image omission or degradation

Choice.Label: Tumor in vein
Choice.Hint: Unequivocal enhancing soft tissue in vein, regardless of visualization of parenchymal mass

Choice.Label: Definitely benign
Choice.Hint: Cyst Hemangioma Perfusion alteration Hepatic fat deposition Focal fat sparing Hypertrophic pseudomass Confluent fibrosis Focal scar

Choice.Label: Probably benign
Choice.Hint: Cyst Hemangioma Perfusion alteration Hepatic fat deposition Focal fat sparing Hypertrophic pseudomass Confluent fibrosis Focal scar Distinctive nodule without malignant imaging features

Choice.Label: Probably or definitely malignant but not HCC specific
Choice.Hint: e.g., if targetoid

Choice.Label: Arterial phase images degraded by motion/artifact
Postarterial phase images degraded by motion/artifact

Diagram.Label: Treatment response cannot be evaluated due image degradation or omission

Choice.Label: If treatment response cannot be evaluated due image degradation or omission
Distinctive nodule, less than 20 mm, NO major features, NO LR-M features, NO ancillary features favoring malignancy

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Enhancement in an expected treatment-specific pattern?

NumericDataElement.Label: Size of largest enhancing component (in mm)
NumericDataElement.Hint: Size of largest enhancing component (in mm)

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Pattern of enhancement (pick all that apply)

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Is TIV contiguous with a parenchymal mass?

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Targetoid LR-M features (any of the following)

Choice.Label: Rim APHE
Choice.Hint: Spatially defined subtype of APHE in which arterial phase enhancement is most pronounced in observation periphery

Choice.Label: Peripheral “washout”
Choice.Hint: Spatially defined subtype of “washout” in which apparent washout is most pronounced in observation periphery

Choice.Label: Delayed central enhancement
Choice.Hint: Central area of progressive postarterial phase enhancement

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Nontargetoid LR-M features (any of the following)

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Nonrim arterial phase hyperenhancement
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Enhancement in the arterial phase that is less than that of liver.

NumericDataElement.Label: Observation size (mm)
NumericDataElement.Hint: Size of the lesion (outer edge to outer edge) in mm

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Nonperipheral "washout"
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Visually assessed temporal reduction in enhancement relative to liver from an earlier to a later phase resulting in portal venous phase hypoenhancement or delayed phase hypoenhancement.

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Enhancing "capsule"
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Peripheral rim of smooth hyper-enhancement in the portal venous phase or delayed phase that unequivocally is thicker or more conspicuous than the rims surrounding background nodule.

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Threshold growth (≥50% size increase in ≤6 months?)
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Increase in diameter of a mass compared to its baseline by a minimum of 5 mm AND depending on the time interval between examinations, by the following amounts: less than or equal to 6 months: >50% diameter increase greater than 6 months: >100% diameter increase

NumericDataElement.Label: Size on the prior study
NumericDataElement.Hint: Size on the prior study in mm

NumericDataElement.Label: Time period since the prior study
NumericDataElement.Hint: Time period since the prior study

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Do you want to adjust category based on ancillary features?

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: What ancillary features of malignancy are present? (pick all that apply)

Choice.Label: US visibility as discrete nodule
Choice.Hint: Unenhanced US visibility as discrete nodule or mass corresponding to CT- or MRI-detected observation

Choice.Label: Subthreshold growth
Choice.Hint: Unequivocal size increase of a mass, less than threshold growth.

Choice.Label: Corona enhancement
Choice.Hint: Periobservational enhancement in late arterial phase or early PVP attributable to venous drainage from tumor

Choice.Label: Fat sparing in solid mass
Choice.Hint: Relative paucity of fat in solid mass relative to steatotic liver OR in inner nodule relative to steatotic outer nodule

Choice.Label: Restricted diffusion
Choice.Hint: Intensity on DWI, not attributable solely to T2 shine-through, unequivocally higher than liver and/or ADC unequivocally lower than liver

Choice.Label: Mild-moderate T2 hyperintensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity on T2WI mildly or moderately higher than liver and similar to or less than non-iron-overloaded spleen

Choice.Label: Iron sparing in solid mass
Choice.Hint: Paucity of iron in solid mass relative to iron-overloaded liver OR in inner nodule relative to siderotic outer nodule

Choice.Label: Transitional phase hypointensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity in the transitional phase unequivocally less, in whole or in part, than liver

Choice.Label: Hepatobiliary phase hypointensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity in the hepatobiliary phase unequivocally less, in whole or in part, than liver

Choice.Label: Nonenhancing “capsule”
Choice.Hint: Capsule appearance not visible as an enhancing rim

Choice.Label: Nodule-in-nodule architecture
Choice.Hint: Presence of smaller inner nodule within and having different imaging features than larger outer nodule

Choice.Label: Mosaic architecture
Choice.Hint: Presence of randomly distributed internal nodules or compartments, usually with different imaging features

Choice.Label: Fat in mass, more than adjacent liver
Choice.Hint: Excess fat within a mass, in whole or in part, relative to adjacent liver
Choice.ReportText: Fat in mass, more than adjacent liver

Choice.Label: Blood products in mass
Choice.Hint: Intralesional or perilesional hemorrhage in the absence of biopsy, trauma or intervention

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: what ancillary features of benignity are present? (pick all that apply)

Choice.Label: Size stability ≥ 2 years
Choice.Hint: No significant change in observation size measured on exams ≥ 2 years apart in absence of treatment

Choice.Label: Size reduction
Choice.Hint: Unequivocal spontaneous decrease in size over time, not attributable to artifact, measurement error, technique differences, or resorption of blood products

Choice.Label: Parallels blood pool enhancement
Choice.Hint: Temporal pattern in which enhancement eventually reaches and then matches that of blood pool

Choice.Label: Undistorted vessels
Choice.Hint: Vessels traversing an observation without displacement, deformation, or other alteration

Choice.Label: Iron in mass, more than liver
Choice.Hint: Excess iron in a mass relative to background liver
Choice.ReportText: Iron in mass, more than liver

Choice.Label: Marked T2 hyperintensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity on T2WI markedly higher than liver and similar to bile ducts and other fluid-filled structures

Choice.Label: Hepatobiliary phase isointensity
Choice.Hint: Intensity in hepatobiliary phase nearly identical to liver

Branch.Label: If treatment response cannot be evaluated due image degradation or omission

DecisionPoint.Label: Enhancement in an expected treatment-specific pattern?
Is enhancement nodular OR mass-like OR thick irregular at the periphery?
Untreated observation without pathologic proof in patient at high-risk for HCC

Branch.Label: Cannot be categorized due to image degradation or omission

DecisionPoint.Label: Is TIV contiguous with a parenchymal mass?
Is parenchymal mass targetoid not selected

Branch.Label: Probably or definitely malignant but not HCC specific

Branch.ReportText: LR category has been adjusted based on the selected ancillary features favoring malignancy
LR category has been adjusted based on the selected ancillary features favoring benignity
Enhancement in a nodular, mass-like or thick irregular pattern:
Imaging features of the parenchymal mass:
Cannot be categorized due to image omission/degradation
LI-RADS v2018 Category: LR-TIV (Tumor in vein), etiology uncertain
LI-RADS v2018 Category: LR-TIV (Tumor in vein), probably due to HCC
LR-TIV (Tumor in vein), probably due to HCC,

EndPoint.Label: [LR-TIV, May be due to non-HCC malignancy]

Branch.ReportText: LI-RADS v2018 Category: LR-TIV (Tumor in vein), may be due to non-HCC malignancy
LR-TIV (Tumor in vein), may be due to non-HCC malignancy,
LI-RADS v2018 Catogery: LR-TIV (Tumor in vein), definitely due to HCC
LR-TIV (Tumor in vein), definitely due to HCC,
LR-M (Probably or definitely malignant, not HCC specific)
